page.title: 01N.SWANSEA - URBAN LANDSCAPE
page.content:
In the east, the reclamation of the Swansea Valley is well advanced. The derelict metal works and slag heaps have gone, and we are seeing the birth of an Enterprise Zone(new industrial estates) and an Urban Park (forests, lakes and an athletics stadium). The valleysides still carry the long, terraced streets built for workers in the old metal industries,-Pentrechwyth to the east and Landore, Plasmarl and Morriston to the west.
Further west, rectangular patterns of old housing make up Manselton and climb to the higher ground through Brynhyfryd and Treboeth. The western fringes of the built-up area, however, in Penlan and Clase, consist largely of curving rows of post-war council housing bordering areas of commonland and farmland.
